subject: RE: [junit] UI testing am I being lazy?
msgSnippet: ... I spend a lot of time punishing myself:( (though not as much as I used to!) ... I am getting that warm feeling back again - thank you
messageBody:
J. B. wrote:
> I don't like to write End to End tests; however, when someone returns
> me a defect, I have to admit that I missed something, and to punish
> myself, I do things I don't like. I do this:

I spend a lot of time punishing myself:( (though not as much as I used to!)

>
> 1. write a failing end to end test that shows the defect
> 2. test-drive the fix
>
> Do you need both tests? No. But in the long run, and as a general
> practice, you /want/ both tests.

I am getting that "warm" feeling back again - thank you
